result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin P Kulesha

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin P Kulesha appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Kevin P Kulesha.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court MODIFIES the no contact order to no VIOLENT contact with the victim.

Defendant Kevin P Kulesha appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Kevin P Kulesha.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Kevin P Kulesha in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defense counsel requests a Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 29.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-14-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANS. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Kevin P Kulesha in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
